basics.name: Yuheng Wang
basics.label: Undergraduate, Engineering Physics & ECE
basics.summary: Undergraduate in Engineering Physics (UMich) and ECE (SJTU). Interests: quantum physics, non-Hermitian photonics, and AI/ML for scientific discovery.

work.name: University of Michigan, Department of Radiation Oncology
work.summary: Equating the Biologically Effective Dose of SBRT and 90Y SIRT; ReMasker-Cox for survival-guided imputation.
highlights: Voxel-level k1(x) pipeline and dose binning
CoxPH-augmented masked autoencoder for tabular data

work.name: University of Michigan, Deng Research Lab
work.summary: Loss–induced synthetic magnetic field; non-Hermitian exciton-polariton transport.
highlights: Ring-resonator arrays and non-Hermitian skin effect

work.name: Shanghai Jiao Tong University, LUIS Lab
work.summary: PT method for chip-scale WPT; ML for mmWave voice/vital signals.

work.name: K-free Technology Co., LTD.
work.summary: Implemented MCU features in C; adhered to company code standards.

education.institution: University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, USA
Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China

awards.title: Michigan Engineering Continuing Student Scholarship (Roger King Scholarship)
Meritorious Winner, COMAP's Mathematical Contest in Modeling (MCM)
First Prize, Chinese Physics Olympiad (Guangdong Province)

publications.name: Breaking PT symmetry of hybridized edge modes in non-Hermitian topological photonic molecules

projects.name: Loss–Induced Synthetic Magnetic Field
projects.summary: Design and simulation of rotationally asymmetric Si ring–resonator arrays to engineer loss–induced synthetic magnetic fields; analysis of non-Hermitian skin effect.

projects.name: ReMasker-Cox
projects.summary: Survival-guided masked autoencoder for missing data imputation on clinical tabular datasets with CoxPH loss.

projects.name: Dose Equivalence for SBRT and 90Y SIRT
projects.summary: Voxel-level pipeline and biological dose harmonization across modalities using EQD2 and protraction-aware BED.
